Class Association

Namespace
NDSH.Geospatial.Metadata.V2003.Gml.Base
Assembly
NDSH.Geospatial.Metadata.V2003.dll

Represents a generalized association in GML, providing an XLink-based mechanism for referencing external or internal resources within geospatial metadata. This abstract class implements the GML AssociationAttributeGroup pattern from gmlBase.xsd, enabling a standard approach for linking GML objects and facilitating interoperability with ISO 19115:2003 metadata structures.

[Serializable]
[JsonObject("Association")]
public abstract class Association : ObservableModel, IModel, IObservableModel, INotifyPropertyChanged, IAssociation, ISimpleLink, IType, IHref, IRole, IArcRole, ITitle, IShow, IActuate, INilReason, IRemoteSchema

Remarks

In practice, GML uses “association” elements or properties to capture relationships between metadata objects or geospatial features—often expressed through the xlink attributes (href, role, arcrole, title, show, and actuate). By abstracting these attributes into a single class, Association enables a consistent mechanism for referencing remote or local resources.

The class also supports a nilReason attribute (based on GML’s NilReasonType) to indicate missing or inapplicable data, reflecting the requirements of ISO 19115:2003 for managing incomplete or unknown metadata values. Additionally, a remoteSchema attribute is provided to reference an external schema, though it is marked as deprecated in GML.

In ISO 19115 applications, leveraging this association pattern can help decompose or link metadata elements effectively, fostering modular metadata design and allowing distributed systems to reference shared resources rather than duplicating content.

Properties

Actuate

Gets/Sets the Actuate attribute which is used to communicate the desired timing of traversal from the starting resource to the ending resource.

Use the ActuateBehaviours static property to access all valid string values used in the Actuate property. Select a valid value using as a key an ActuateBehaviour enumerated value.

Example: 

= []

[JsonProperty("actuate")]
public string Actuate { get; set; }

Property Value

string

Exceptions

ArgumentOutOfRangeException

The exception is thrown when the property is attempted to be set to a string value that is not in the list of the accepted values.

ActuateBehaviours

Gets the ReadOnlyDictionary<TKey, TValue> of valid values used for the Actuate attribute (Actuate property), which determines how a link is triggered.

public static ReadOnlyDictionary<ActuateBehaviour, string> ActuateBehaviours { get; }

Property Value

ReadOnlyDictionary<ActuateBehaviour, string>

ArcRole

Gets/Sets a more detailed function of the link, similar to the value of Role but more specialized.

[JsonProperty("arcrole")]
public string ArcRole { get; set; }

Property Value

string

Href

Gets/Sets a reference to a remote resource via a URI.

[JsonProperty("href")]
public string Href { get; set; }

Property Value

string

NilReason

Gets/Sets an explanation for why a value is missing.

The NilReason is a string value of one of the following three options:

  1. The value is a low case string representation of one of the values of the NullEnumeration, except the value Other
  2. The value is a combination of the low case string representation of the value Other followed by : and then by a string providing a brief explanation, where text is a string of two or more characters with no included spaces.
    Example: other:brief explanation goes here
    The entire string must be valid against the following regular expression:
    other:\w{2,}
  3. The value is a Uniform Resource Identifier (URI).
    A particular community may choose to assign more detailed semantics to the standard values provided by the NullEnumeration. Alternatively, the URI method enables a specific or more complete explanation for the absence of a value to be provided elsewhere and indicated by-reference in an instance document.

Example: 

<pre><code class="lang-csharp">NilReason = INilReason.GetNilReason(NullEnumeration.Missing);
NilReason = INilReason.GetNilReason(NullEnumeration.Other, "Example reason give here");
NilReason = INilReason.GetNilReason("http://www.example.com/a-detailed-explanation-for-nilreason/";</code></pre>


[JsonProperty("nilReason")]
public string NilReason { get; set; }

Property Value

string

Remarks

The default NilReason value is: "unknown", the XML enum value of the Unknown.

NilReasons

Gets a ReadOnlyDictionary<TKey, TValue> where each NullEnumeration key maps to an explanatory string used by the NilReason property to describe missing or voided metadata values in XML files.

public static ReadOnlyDictionary<NullEnumeration, string> NilReasons { get; }

Property Value

ReadOnlyDictionary<NullEnumeration, string>

RemoteSchema

Gets/Sets a reference to an external remote schema.

[Obsolete("RemoteSchema is marked as deprecated in gml/gmlBase.xsd")]
[JsonProperty("remoteSchema")]
[JsonIgnore]
public string? RemoteSchema { get; set; }

Property Value

string

Remarks

This is an obsolete property. (Marked deprecated in gml/gmlBase.xsd)

Role

Gets/Sets the role of the link, specifying its function within an association.

[JsonProperty("role")]
public string Role { get; set; }

Property Value

string

Show

Gets/Sets the Show attribute which is used to communicate the desired presentation of the ending resource on traversal from the starting resource.

Use the ShowBehaviours static property to access all valid string values used in the Show property. Select a valid value using as a key an ShowBehaviour enumerated value.

Example: 

= []

[JsonProperty("show")]
public string Show { get; set; }

Property Value

string

Exceptions

ArgumentOutOfRangeException

The exception is thrown when the property is attempted to be set to a string value that is not in the list of the accepted values.

ShowBehaviours

Gets the ReadOnlyDictionary<TKey, TValue> of valid values used for the Show attribute (Show property), which determines how a linked resource should be displayed.

public static ReadOnlyDictionary<ShowBehaviour, string> ShowBehaviours { get; }

Property Value

ReadOnlyDictionary<ShowBehaviour, string>

Title

Gets/Sets the descriptive title of the linked resource.

[JsonProperty("title")]
public string Title { get; set; }

Property Value

string

Type

Gets/Sets the type of the reference, which is always "simple".

[JsonProperty("type")]
public string Type { get; }

Property Value

string

Methods

GetNilReason(NullEnumeration, string)

Generates a NilReason string based on a predefined enumeration value. The method can be used to set the string value of the NilReason property.

The procedure makes sure that rules for setting the string are observed and should be preferably used rather than setting the string value using the property's setter. The reason for having a public setter in the NilReason property is to allow for XML deserialization.

Example: 

<pre><code class="lang-csharp">NilReason = INilReason.GetNilReason(NullEnumeration.Missing);
NilReason = INilReason.GetNilReason(NullEnumeration.Other, "Example reason given here");</code></pre>


public static string GetNilReason(NullEnumeration nullEnum, string otherAdditionalReason = "Reason not in list")

Parameters

nullEnum NullEnumeration

The NullEnumeration value.

otherAdditionalReason string

Allows a string value providing a brief reason to be appended after the Other. The argument's value will be used only if the enumerated value provided is NullEnumeration; in all other cases the argument's value will be omitted.

Returns

string

A properly formatted string with the NilReason.

GetNilReason(string)

Generates a NilReason string based on a URI reference. The method can be used to set the string value of the NilReason property.

Example: 

<pre><code class="lang-csharp">NilReason = INilReason.GetNilReason("http://www.example.com/a-detailed-explanation-for-nilreason/";</code></pre>


public static string GetNilReason(string uriString)

Parameters

uriString string

The string holding a URI describing in detail the reason for a null / void or exception.

Returns

string

A string with the Nil Reason.

Remarks

The URI method enables a specific or more complete explanation for the absence of a value to be provided elsewhere and indicated by-reference in an instance document.
